data.title: RE: Hyperlink from within Netview.
data.text: Thank you Leslie. Bernard Baudoux Phone: +32 (0)2/565.24.68 e-mail : bernard.baudoux AT fortisbank DOT com > -----Original Message----- > From: Leslie Clark [SMTP:lclark AT us.ibm DOT com] > Sent: Tuesday, 12 December, 2000 07:33 > To: IBM NetView Discussion > Subject: Re: [NV-L] Hyperlink from within Netview. > > There is already a hook for this, at least in V6. See these lines > in the header of oid_to_type: > > # W Assume the device has a default Web management page at > # "http://hostname". The following fields will be created if > necessary > # and set, > # isHTTPSupported TRUE > # isHTTPManaged TRUE > # ManagementURL "http://hostname" > > You can change the url to whatever you want using nvdbimport. In fact > you could skip the oid_to_type, I think, and add and set these fields > yourself > using nvdbimport. You launch the web page from a menu pick, I think it is > under Tools or Administer, Web, something. It is intended to take you > to the device's web server, as some devices can be configured using > built-in web servers. But I don't see why you could not use it for > whatever > you like. > > Cordially, > > Leslie A. Clark > IBM Global Services - Systems Mgmt & Networking > Detroit > > > BAUDOUX BERNARD <bernard.baudoux AT fortisbank DOT com>@tkg.com on 12/08/2000 > 09:47:07 AM > > Please respond to IBM NetView Discussion <nv-l AT tkg DOT com> > > Sent by: owner-nv-l AT tkg DOT com > > > To: "'NETVIEW FORUM'" <nv-l AT tkg DOT com> > cc: > Subject: [NV-L] Hyperlink from within Netview. > > > > Hello all Netviewers, > > I'm running NetView 5.1.2 on AIX 4.2.1 and NetView 6.0.1 on AIX 4.3.3 > > Is anybody aware of any way to include a hyperlink (http) from NetView. > What I would like to do is add a menu item which would "activate" an http > page if youselect a device. The page should be different according to > the > type of device (let's say a page for the routers, another page for the > switches, etc.) > I guess the browser would run on the RS/6000 box if we use an X-Terminal > session, or the PC browser if we use the NetView Web interface. Right ? > > Any suggestion most appreciated, > Thanks in advance, > Bernard Baudoux > Phone: +32 (0)2/565.24.68 > e-mail : bernard.baudoux AT fortisbank DOT com > > > _________________________________________________________________________ > NV-L List information and Archives: http://www.tkg.com/nv-l > >
